org.deidentifier.arx.risk
Class PopulationModel

java.lang.Object
  org.deidentifier.arx.risk.PopulationModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
EquivalenceClassModel, UniquenessModel
public abstract class PopulationModel
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the basis for estimating both population uniqueness and equivalence class risk.

          size of biggest equivalence class in the data set

          size of smallest equivalence class in the data set

protected  int n
          size of the data set aka sample
protected  int N
          size of the population, this value is estimated using the sample size and the sampling fraction
protected  double pi
          sampling fraction
protected  int u
          Number of equivalence classes that exist in the sample

Field Detail

pi

protected double pi
sampling fraction

n

protected int n
size of the data set aka sample

N

protected int N
size of the population, this value is estimated using the sample size and the sampling fraction

eqClasses

protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> eqClasses
Map containing the equivalence class sizes (as keys) of the data set and the corresponding frequency (as values) e.g. if the key 2 has value 3 then there are 3 equivalence classes of size two.

u

protected int u
Number of equivalence classes that exist in the sample

Cmax

protected int Cmax
size of biggest equivalence class in the data set

Cmin

protected int Cmin
size of smallest equivalence class in the data set

Constructor Detail

PopulationModel

public PopulationModel(double pi,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> eqClasses)
Creates a model of the data set that allows for estimating the disclosure risk of the data

Parameters:
pi - sampling fraction
eqClasses - Map containing the equivalence class sizes (as keys) of the data set and the corresponding frequency (as values) e.g. if the key 2 has value 3 then there are 3 equivalence classes of size two.
Method Detail

computeRisk

public abstract double computeRisk()
computes the re-identification risk on a file level for a given data set and a given measurement scenario (population unique vs. equivalence class based)

Returns:
A single number representing the disclosure risk on a file level, depending on the model this estimate is based on population uniqueness or equivalence class size and frequency
